content: A new proposal has been announced: Don't build tools by default with x.py build #351. It will be announced at the next meeting to try and draw attention to it, but usually MCPs are not discussed during triage meetings. If you think this would benefit from discussion amongst the team, consider proposing a design meeting.
@T-compiler: Proposal #351 has been seconded, and will be approved in 10 days if no objections are raised.
yes, I was wondering why this suddenly took so long
I meant to put it in the original MCP but forgot to add it :laughing:
and by the time I thought of it it had already been accepted
will try to implement it this weekend
Hmm ... what should the new way to build all tools be?
I don't want to build every tool, like a glob implies, just the ones I enabled in my configuration.
It should be easy to add an alias like "src/tools" or "tools" which builds the ones enabled in config
current status: I still plan to implement this, but I'm holding off until x.py gets a changelog so it's less disruptive: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/76617
